content: पाक {%<ab>a.</ab>%} {@--1@} Small. {@--2@} Praiseworthy. {@--3@} Of perfected or matured intellect. {@--4@} <ab>Ved.</ab> Very young. {@--5@} Simple, genuine {@--6@} Honest, sincere. {@--7@} Ignorant. --कः {@--1@} [पच्-घञ्] Cooking, dressing, baking, boiling. {@--2@} Burning (as bricks), baking; <ls>Ms. 5. 122</ls>; <ls>Y. 1. 187.</ls> {@--3@} Digestion (as of food). {@--4@} Ripeness; ओषध्यः फलपाकांताः <ls>Ms. 1. 46</ls>; पलमभिमुखपाकं राजजंबूद्रुमस्य <ls>V. 4. 13</ls>; <ls>Māl. 9. 31.</ls> {@--5@} Maturity, full or perfect development; धी°, मति° {@--6@} Completion, accomplishment, fulfilment; युयोज पाकाभिमुखैर्भृत्यान् विज्ञापनाफलैः <ls>R. 17. 40.</ls> {@--7@} Result, consequence, fruit, fruition (fig also); आशीर्भिरेधयामासुः पुरःपाकाभिरंबिकां <ls>Ku. 6. 90</ls>; पाकाभिमुखस्य दैवस्य <ls>U. 7. 4</ls>; <ls>Mv. 4. 14.</ls> {@--8@} Development of the consequences of acts done. {@--9@} Grain, corn; नीवारपाकादि <ls>R. 5. 9</ls> (पच्यते इति पाकः धान्यं). {@--10@} Ripeness, suppuration (as of a boil). {@--11@} Greyness of hair caused by old age. {@--12@} A domestic fire. {@--13@} An owl. {@--14@} A child, young one. {@--15@} <ab>N.</ab> of a demon killed by Indra. {@--16@} An abscess, ulcer. {@--17@} A vessel, cooking-utensil. {@--18@} General fear and panic such as causes a revolution or some national calamity. {@--19@} The subversion of a country.
